meanings.definition: Having or showing a sensible and practical idea of what can be achieved or expected.
meanings.sent1: She had a realistic plan to finish her homework on time.
meanings.sent2: It is realistic to expect some traffic during rush hour.
meanings.sent3: His realistic approach to packing for the trip made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's realistic view of the students' abilities was refreshing.
meanings.sent5: The realistic advice from the experienced hiker saved them from getting lost.

meanings.definition: Representing things in a way that is accurate and true to life.
meanings.sent1: The painting had a realistic depiction of the countryside.
meanings.sent2: The movie used realistic special effects to make the scene believable.
meanings.sent3: The realistic portrayal of the talking animals in the cartoon was hilarious.
meanings.sent4: Her realistic description of the storm made it sound like a monster.
meanings.sent5: The realistic details in the novel made the story come alive.
